intro: Hieracium macradenium, commonly known as the large-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late summer to early autumn. Hieracium macradenium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
